channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why an AI energy crisis may not unfold how you think
item.description: Fears that data centers would devour our power grid were rampant in the early 2000s. The solution wasn’t more power plants.

item.title: Texas GOP could stall Trump’s bold AI vision with red tape as China races ahead: 'Investors are nervous'
item.description: President Trump’s AI infrastructure push may face major delays as Texas Republicans back a bill adding red tape and costs to key data center projects.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs dash hopes of VC comeback in 2025: ‘It’s going to be an ugly problem’
item.description: Tariff uncertainty is putting even more pressure on the VC market, leaving investors hesitant as tech companies postpone IPOs.

item.title: Biden, in first speech since leaving office, says Trump is threatening Social Security

item.title: To Save Medicaid, We Have to Cut It
item.description: Medicaid reform doesn’t mean abandoning the disadvantaged.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg on the stand: ‘Crazy,’ ‘scary’ ideas led him to buy Instagram and WhatsApp
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg was the leadoff witness in an antitrust case against Meta – one filed under the first term of the president he's now cozying up to.

item.title: Free Traders Are Talking Past the Working Class
item.description: The free trade case is correct. But free traders need to frame their arguments differently.

item.title: Exclusive: Senators Elizabeth Warren and Andy Kim demand investigation into DOGE cuts at CFPB
item.description: Warren, who had conceived of and oversaw the creation of the financial watchdog agency after the financial crisis, is now trying to defend it.

item.title: Global stocks decline as U.S. imposes ban on Nvidia exports to China

item.title: Tariffs are coming for America’s favorite beer—but Modelo maker says it’s Trump’s immigration crackdown that’s hurting sales
item.description: Constellation Brands warns that while new tariffs will raise costs, it is President Trump’s immigration crackdown that is already driving down sales.

item.title: A Minecraft Movie Fights Cultural Inertia with Joy
item.description: Jared Hess’s gamer movie dreams of capitalist innovation.

item.title: Harvard Discovers What Federal Money Costs
item.description: The Trump administration’s overreaching demands of Harvard are merely a symptom of excessive federal involvement in universities.

item.title: Scientists: Doctors Give Kids ADHD Drugs For Adults’ Convenience
item.description: Clearly, schools are a bad environment for a heck of a lot of little boys, if one-quarter have to be medicated just to go there.

item.title: New Englanders Know the Trump Tax Cuts Need to Be Extended
item.description: Higher taxes and fewer jobs are not a recipe for economic growth. New Englanders will get both if Congress fails to extend the TCJA.

item.title: Book Review: Quantitative Risk and Portfolio Management: Theory and Practice
